title: The Community of League of Legends and Bullying is Out of Control
body: > The League of Legends community has become a cesspool of horrible people, League of Legends and Riot should be beyond ashamed for allowing such a horrible fan base exist on their game and for not bringing the hammer down on those who would bully other players. honestly its cowardly and neglectful that this company has not taken greater efforts to eliminate trolls and bullies alike. about two weeks ago I booted the game up again after a year or more of not playing. MY TEAM WAS WINNING and yet for some reason three other players decided to bully me for not only accidentally choosing the wrong character but apparently taking kills from them...I cant honestly give two giant turds about this game and had a better time typing to the other team than I did my own. The fact is not that I forgot about the game itself but the fact that I was mercilessly targeted by three players for no reason even while we were winning! they threw racist,sexual, suicidal, mental and physical bullying threats at me and the other player on my team the entire game. THIS IS NOT THE FIRST NOR THE LAST TIME, me and millions of other players have played at least ten or more games with someone either on their own team or on the the other team throwing slander and hate in our direction. I hate to say it Riot...league of legends until you get your act together and start monitoring your game better your fan base is going to keep leaving because they feel harassed and honestly I dont want to play your game ever again due to how horrible people are... I want this to be an eye opener for any devs or site managers to see so if you want post your story about how you were bullied on this game and maybe the game devs will see how they have neglected their players....and if you troll well...your only helping this post. vote on the poll if you want as well.

replies.body:
Riot is the only game company I have seen that actively, consistently, and visibly removes players from their game for harassment, verbal abuse, griefing, and/or bullying. The thing is, bullying is going to happen. The only way for someone to be banned for bullying is AFTER they have bullied someone AND been reported. A lot of people don't report people because that is "tattling", "bitching out", or something like that.

You are the only person that you can count on to stop it, and Riot has given you a way to avoid it and to help remove that person from other people's games. Mute them, report them, then move on with your life.

Also, I am not going to vote in your poll because it is not asking the proper question. Bullying is out of control, but not in league of legends. Bullying is out of control everywhere. Schools, workplaces, the internet. Anywhere not in direct vision of someone who is paid and trained to stop it is filled with bullying, and that is how the world is right now. It isn't right, it isn't good, but its the truth. At least in league you have an automated system watching everything that can deal with issues, learn about new issues, and works quickly relative to all other options, and will only get faster over time.

If you want to try to avoid toxicity altogether, there are a lot of guides but basically:
1: Queue up with friends if you can.
2: Be as visibly positive in the chat as you can if you want to talk at all.
3: Mute anyone that is toxic on first sight.
4: Report toxicity at the end of each game.

Definitely have to agree. Riot so far is the only online gaming company I have actively seen trying to fix toxic/bullying behaviors in its community. 

I've seen even more toxic people in WoW, OW, and HotS that I play daily, but there is no report system in that game except for "cheating" (like hacking or loot-ninja) or "Bug reports". Mostly because the community deals with itself, but Blizzard itself doesn't put its foot down towards toxic behavior unlike Riot does. 

I really have to commend them for trying though. It's hard but Riot is definitely trying its best to deal with the problem, even though that problem will always exist so long as humans have free choice ;P 

If anything bullying in real life is a lot worse because it's much harder to detect or prove. I've had a couple people bully me at my work to the point that my manager had to get involved and got those two fired for harassing me and her D: But oh man was it a lot of legal work and HR meetings.

I don't think we're playing the same game, or even at the same level then. 

WoW does have a lot of toxic players. Especially during raid and endgame content. Hell I've even seen toxic people in starting zones or leveling areas who feel the need to shit all over you or piss on your dead dog if they could. If you try to pug a raid, you'll mostly likely end up with one or two toxic players who spew slurs at you or refuse to listen and kick you for no reason. Even had a buddy kicked from a raid despite being the highest DPS only because he told the RL his strategy was terrible (which it was, he didn't understand the mechanics at all and thought we could just DPS the boss down without moving. Needless to say that raid group gave up after 3 tries of constantly dying). The thing is, in Wow it's a lot easier to ignore assholes like that because you're either in a guild and don't worry about random players, or you don't have to stick with them for 20+ minutes unlike League. Hell you don't even need the chat anymore in WoW. So the toxic players are a lot less transparent, but trust me they still exist and are quite a pain to deal with during raid and dungeons.

OW I've seen plenty. A lot of people shit-talking and cursing others using some pretty "spicy" language for making mistakes or wanting to play whatever hero they want. It's just a lot easier to ignore because rarely anyone pays attention to the chat in OW, but trust me it exists and there is quite a lot. 

HotS also has it's fair share. Even during Alpha it had plenty of toxic players who would even tell you "KYS" because you swapped a lane or focused on camps instead of killing heroes. Might have been some of the league players swapping over to HotS at the time, but trust me I've seen plenty of toxic players there in Alpha, Beta, and during Launch. 

League's toxicity is a lot more visible because of the reason you're stuck with that player for the whole game, and also because the chat does serve a pretty big function to communicating. Doesn't mean it's the only game with a toxicity problem, but Riot as a company so far is definitely the most active and visible when it comes to combating that issue. 

Blizzard does its fair share, but they aren't as worried about it as Riot is mostly for the reasons I suggested above. Chat doesn't serve a huge function in OW or HotS. In WoW it kind of can, but most players have addons and pull timers to communicate. Whereas league if you ping it gets thrown into chat, any notice is put into the chat, and sometimes if you don't have a ping that works for what you want you tend to have to use the chat. Also I still remember a time where we didn't even have this many pings, so Riot is definitely working hard towards reducing the need for chat but still allowing for lots of communication.

I don't entirely understand why you're bashing the league community so much. I mean yeah, there are some pretty toxic people in league, but the same goes for every game. Forums or not toxic people will always exist. It just depends on how visible they are compared to others. Chat is the easiest way to spew toxicity, and like I said League does focus a lot on chat for communication compared to the other games I listed. 
Also, Wow is still technically compared to League since they're both social environment type of games. However, WoW nowadays really doesn't need chat except for in Trade Channel (if you can dig through the thousands of spam posts). The game has become simplified and streamlined for new players, so chat isn't really needed as it used to be. League still does need the chat to function unfortunately, and that's why toxicity is a lot more visible in game compared to WoW. Because in WoW you can leave a group without facing a penalty if someone is toxic or acting like an asshole. You can leave a raid or whatever and simple carry on your way or find a new group. League you can't really do that. So it only feels like it's more toxic, but really they aren't that different.

Also, the LoL Boards are mostly filled with Memes or people whining about unjust bans/punishment/nerfs/buffs/whatever they feel like complaining about this week. Sounds similar to WoW Boards, but even then the boards are a very small percentage of the playerbase, and the games still share the same amount of toxicity. All that matters is the **visibility** of the toxicity. And because of how League works, it **looks** more toxic than WoW, but the same toxic players exist in both spaces. I mean shit look at Dota, still has a toxic playerbase (mostly suffers from elitism), it's just not as big/popular as League so everyone focuses their gaze on League's toxicity rather than other games that still harbor the problem.

You start the game, go to your position. If you are jungle say thank you for the leash. If you are a laner try to identify something that someone else did, then say "Nice X". If you are mid and you notice your top laner is out cs'ing their opponent, say "Nice farm, keep that up and we will win for sure!".

Honestly it even works in bad situations. Your top laner dies in a close fight? "That was a close one, I will try to gank in a minute so you can catch back up."
